result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:55 AM cases 22CF911, 22CF858, 22CF828 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Steven G. Vetrone in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Steven G. Vetrone. Attorney Schmidt requests a new return date.
Hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 11:29 AM.
Prosecuting Attorney Andrew James Gunderson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Steven G. Vetrone appeared by video, in custody from the jail with Attorney Ryan Kohler.
Defendant waives reading of Complaint. Time limits for preliminary hearing waived. State requests $250 Cash Bond (continued bond violations). Court orders $2,000 Cash Bond.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 8/15/22 at 3:00 PM.
RTN: 9/7/22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions: 
No contact with L.S., their residence, their employer.
Visitation/exchange to be arranged through third party.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer.
